alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 3:10AM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM MST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Arizona, including the following county, Pima. * WHEN...Until 515 AM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 310 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Three Points, Tucson Estates, Valencia West and Ryan AirField. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
